text: Julius S. Youngner (24 October 1920 - 27 April 2017)Obituary: Julius Youngner | Last surviving member of Salk vaccine team was an American Distinguished Service Professor in the School of Medicine and Department of Microbiology & Molecular Genetics at University of Pittsburgh responsible for advances necessary for development of a vaccine for poliomyelitis and the first intranasal equine influenza vaccine. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American biologists Category:Educators from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City Category:Scientists from Philadelphia Category:Educators from Philadelphia
title: Julius Youngner
